title: 'I've been patronised and faced sexism my entire life - now I want to make sure that girls don't'
text:
What do teenage girls living in rural Chile, Naples, Singapore, a favela in Brazil, a wealthy London suburb and Silicon Valley have in common?

The answer is simple: a lack of self-confidence. I lead the global initiative Inspiring Girls, which connects thousands of 12-14 years olds with female role models in 13 countries - soon to be 14. Wherever we go, whether a wealthy nation or a poor one, we keep finding girls who start dropping school subjects (mostly maths and science) and sports at around that age because they think they are ‘not for girls’.

The question I am most asked is: "where did you find your self-confidence?"

I am convinced that the issues with self confidence that affect so many...
description: What do teenage girls living in rural Chile, Naples, Singapore, a favela in Brazil, a wealthy London suburb and Silicon Valley have in common?
